Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2014 03:56PM sassyon3rd wrote: Back from consult.  Biopsy scheduled for 12/09...then follow-up with surgeon 12/12. She said "we don't know yet if it's cancer or not but if it is, we have caught it early...Stage I"  Still on pins and needles.  BP was through the roof when I got in exam room.  I def need to learn some relaxing breathing techniques. :/
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2014 07:42PM sassyon3rd wrote: I'm calling first thing in the morning.  Will have it just in case. One thing that I'm hopeful for is that I remember them asking me if I had injured my breast, had any other biopsies, etc on my breast.  I said no.  I had completely forgotten about something that happened mid-September until I dreamed about it last night. I was carrying a very large appx 28lb box into the local Fed-Ex drop off.  I could barely get it into the door and it started falling. The contents were very expensive and I didn't want it hitting the ground.  I just remember pushing myself into it to keep it from falling.  My finger was mashed against the brick wall and the corner of the box went right into my breast...right at the are"1:00" area where my spot is. Don't know if there is a correlation but I'm sure hoping that may be a cause. I was thankful for the sleep last night AND the dream. It helped ease my mind today.  Plus I cleaned out 2 closets trying to stay busy.
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2014 08:29AM sassyon3rd wrote:  I agree.  At times I feel like I just may lose my mind.  Then I think about all the others on here that are going thru the EXACT same thing and somehow it helps me calm down...realizing I'm not the only one feeling this way. A friend that went thru this last year suggested I get a script for Ativan for my nerves.  I've never taken anything like that and don't like the idea BUT if it would help, I may have to look into that (especially on biopsy day) :(
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2014 07:14AM sassyon3rd wrote: Thank you!!! Almost there now.
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: sassyon3rd wrote: OK...all this started 2 weeks ago when I got a call about my routine mammogram.  They noted a "change" from prior year's images and I need another.  Fast-forward to 11/25 and 2nd mammogram done along with ultra-sound.  Radiologist came in and said I needed to schedule an appointment with surgeon for biopsy.  I wanted to RUN far and fast.  I have a surgical consult appointment tomorrow.  I've had the images in my possession since last Wednesday but hadn't opened the packet until this morning.  I've gone thru the usual roller-coaster of emotions from "It's nothing, I'm going to be fine"  to the "HOW am I going to deal with this".  So, I did open the little packet this morning and lo and behold there is a report.  Impression:  BIRADS 5.  Mass is 6x5x9mm with ill-defined and angulated margins. Dark clouds started creeping in. :(  Asking for prayers, positive thoughts, advice.....all welcome!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2014 12:41PM sassyon3rd wrote: Biopsy completed...however...apparently the area that the 4 samples were pulled from doesn't "match" the image on the original mammogram. At least that was how it was explained to me.  She had already told me she wanted me to come back Friday to biopsy 2 areas of microcalcifications that my original radiologist did not mark as an area of concern.  She felt like I had been thru enough today and said that Friday they would do those 2 areas and the original intended area. I had a mammogram just prior to the biopsy and another AFTER the biopsy and the marker put in was not in the original area of concern.  It was all very confusing and I was left with a big ? hanging over my head.  She did say that the samples taken today would give them an idea of "what is going on". I heard the word "shadowing" a couple of times when they were imaging me again right before I left.  Anyone else experienced anything like this?
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2014 10:16AM sassyon3rd wrote: Initial results from biopsy yesterday...positive for ductal cancer...grade 2. That's all I know right now.
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2014 11:07AM sassyon3rd wrote: Results now in from stereotactic biopsies of the 2 areas of microcalcifications.  They are cancerous. The nurse said these are Ductal In Situ...apparently the 1st biopsy from the other mass is invasive/outside the duct.  The report on that one was Est+/Prog+/Her2-.  Still confused as all of this is Greek to me right now.   Ready for my meeting with my "team" Thursday.
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2014 09:44PM sassyon3rd wrote: Thank you for the prayers!! Was it over pretty quick?  I'm hoping for a good night's sleep.  I did get a prescription for Ativan that I have to take about 30 minutes prior to the procedure.  I have never taken it before so I'm hoping it will help calm my nerves.
Posts.Title: TRYING to be positive BIRADS 5 sassyon3rd sassyon3rd

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2014 01:23PM sassyon3rd wrote: DawnRising, Yes, the radiologists nurse called me.  Initially she was checking to see how I did last night...if I had any soreness, etc from the biopsy.  Then there was the dreaded pause followed by "Well...we got the results in..."  I had already half-way prepared myself so it did not come as a COMPLETE shock and I think that helped.  I just went into business mode at that point...writing down everything she said. I am praying for peace of mind for you and B9 results!!!  Keepthefaith & ilovepugs...I will feel much better after the calcification biopsies are done and know what they are....it's all so confusing.  Could these be different types of cancer? I'm trying to stay off "Dr Google".
